children.name: sweat
children.definition: when you sweat your skin becomes wet, because you are hot, nervous, ill etc:đồ mồ hôi
examples: You’re sweating. Why don’t you take your jacket off?
The heat from the lights was making her sweat and her make-up started to run.
sweat profuselysweat a lot
Sweating profusely and gripping the lectern, Anderson began his speech.
sweat like a pig/ sweatbucketsspoken sweat a lot
My God, it’s hot in here - I’m sweating like a pig!
It was tough work. Within minutes we were all sweating buckets.

children.name: perspire
children.definition: to sweat:đổ mồ hôi
examples: She felt hot and awkward and started to perspire.
He was perspiring. It showed on his forehead.
perspire freely/ profuselyperspire a lot
James, who was perspiring profusely, took out a handkerchief and mopped his brow.

children.name: break out in a sweat
children.definition: / break into a sweat to start sweating, especially because you arenervousorafraid:đổ mồ hôi hột, vã mồ hôi hột
examples: I was terrified. My hands were shaking, and I broke out in a sweat.
‘It’s got nothing to do with me,’ she said, breaking into a sweat.
break out in a cold sweat/ break into a cold sweatđổ mồ hôi lạnh
As the security guard approached, I broke into a cold sweat.

children.name: be pouring with sweat
children.definition: be pouring/ dripping with sweat to be sweating a lot:đổ đầy mồ hôi
examples: What on earth have you been doing? You’re dripping with sweat!
Melissa was pouring with sweat, and her hair was stuck to her face.

children.name: sweaty
children.definition: đổ mồ hôi, đầy mồ hôi
examples: I’m all hot and sweaty. I think I’ll take a shower.
He was a short fat guy with big sweaty hands.
The equipment manager collected the sweaty uniforms and took them down to the hotel laundry.

children.name: be covered in sweat
children.definition: be covered/ drenched/ soaked in sweatalsobecovered/drenched/soakedwithsweat to be very wet because you have been sweating a lot:đầy mồ hôi, ướt đẫm mồ hôi
examples: Ian came off the squash court covered in sweat.
I insist my car’s have air conditioning - I hate arriving somewhere drenched with sweat.

children.name: sweat
children.definition: drops of salty liquid that come out through your skin when you are hot, frightened, ill, or doing exercise: mồ hôi
examples: He stopped working for a moment to wipe the sweat off his face.
I got sweat in my eyes and couldn’t see.
beads of sweatdrops of sweat
Beads of sweat appeared on her forehead and she trembled visibly.

children.name: perspiration
children.definition: sweat:mồ hôi
examples: a deodorant that protects against perspiration all day long.
To keep your body cool, wear cotton clothing that absorbs perspiration.
beads of perspirationdrops of perspiration
Beads of perspiration trickled down my back.

children.name: milk
children.definition: a white liquid produced by cows or goats that is drunk by people : sữa
examples: Would you like some milk in your tea?
drink milkDrinking milk keeps your bones strong.
have/take milk(= drink milk in your tea or coffee )Do you take milk in your coffee?
pour milkShe poured some milk into a saucepan.
sour(= not fresh )Milk turns sour very quickly in hot weather.
freshShe made me drink a glass of fresh milk.
coldI can only drink milk if it’s really cold.
hot/warmCan I have a cup of warm milk please?
pasteurized(= milk that has been heated to kill harmful bacteria )a type of cheese made from pasteurized milk
homogenized(= milk that has had the cream mixed into the milk )Most milk sold in stores is homogenized milk.
whole milk(full-fat milk[UK]) (= milk that has not had any fat taken out )The ice cream is made from whole milk.
semi-skimmed milk[UK](low-fat milk) (= milk that has had some of the fat taken out )Adults should drink semi-skimmed milk rather than whole milk.
skimmed milk[UK],skim milk/nonfat milk[US](= milk that has had all the fat taken out )a bowl of cereal with skim milk
long-life milk[UK](= specially treated milk that you can keep for a long time )I’ve got a carton of long-life milk in the cupboard.
powdered milk(dry milk[US])Powdered milk is useful for camping trips.
baby/formula milk(= milk in powder form for babies )Many babies are fed formula milk.
milk bottlePut the empty milk bottles into the crates.
milk carton(= a plastic or cardboard container in which milk is sold )containers such as milk cartons and soap powder boxes
milk jugShe put the butter, jam and milk jug on the table.
milk powderhot water mixed with milk powder
a glass/ bottle/ pint of milkWould you like a glass of milk?

children.name: bile
children.definition: a bitter yellow liquid produced by the liver which helps to digest fat: mật
examples: Meat-eaters must produce extensive bileacidsin their intestines to properly digest the meat that they eat.

children.name: milk
children.definition: a white liquid produced by female animals and women for feeding their babies : sữa (cho con bú)
examples: mothers who believe thatbreast milkis best for their babies
The tiny fox cubs drink nothing but theirmother’s milk.
Breast/Mother'smilk is the best nourishment for a baby.

children.name: snot
children.definition: mucus produced in the nose:nước mũi, dỉ mũi
examples: Tears and snot dripped off my chin on to my breast.
snotty[adj][informal] covered with mucus from the nose
You could have told me I had a snotty nose!
I don't want to use your snotty handkerchief!
snotty-nosed[UK]snot-nosed[US]adjective informalused about an annoying child :
a snotty-nosed little kid

children.name: booger
children.definition: / bogey  a piece of dried mucus from inside the nose: rỉ mũi khô

children.name: mucus
children.definition: a thick liquid produced inside the nose and other parts of the body: nước nhầy
examples: This drug reduces mucus production in the gut.

children.name: sperm
children.definition: a reproductive cell produced by a male animal: tinh trùng
examples: In human reproduction, one female egg is usually fertilized by one sperm.
sperm[ U ] informal for semen (= the thick, whitish, slightly sticky liquid that is produced by the male sex organs, and which contains sperm): tinh dịch
semen[ U ] a thick whitish liquid containing sperm which is produced by the sex organs of men and some male animals : tinh dịch

children.name: tear
children.definition: a drop of salty liquid that comes out of your eye when you are crying : nước mắt
examples: Did you notice the tearsinhiseyeswhen he talked about Diane?

children.name: sleep
children.definition: a yellowish substance sometimes found in the corners of the eyes after sleeping: rỉ mắt

children.name: your eyes water
children.definition: if your eyes water, you have tears in your eyes, usually because of something such aswindorsmokegoing into them: chảy nước mắt
examples: Jo’s eyes were watering from the smoke that filled the room.
make your eyes water
An icy wind blew into my face, making my eyes water.

children.name: honeycomb
children.definition: a wax structure containing many small holes which is made by bees to store their honey: tầng ong

children.name: beeswax
children.definition: the substance containing a lot of fat which bees produce, and which is used for making candles and polish for wood: sáp ong

children.name: phlegm
children.definition: a thick substance in your nose and throat that is produced especially when you have a cold : đờm

children.name: spit
children.definition: to force a small amount of saliva out of your mouth : nhổ bọt
examples: Nick rolled down his window and spat.
spit at/on/into
A group of fans spat on the players as they left the field.
spit[ U ] (formalspittle) [informal] saliva, especially when it is outside the mouth
She used a little spit on a tissue to wipe the mirror clean.

children.name: water
children.definition: If your mouth waters, it produces a lot of saliva, usually because you can see or smell some food that you would like to eat: chảy nước miếng
examples: Ooh, the smell of that bread is making my mouth water!

children.name: expectorate
children.definition: to bring up liquid from the throat or lungs and force it out of the mouth: khạc, nhổ
examples: a sign asks visitors not to expectorate in the sinks

children.name: salivate
children.definition: to produce more saliva in your mouth than usual, especially because you see or smell food: tiết nước bọt
examples: The thought of all that delicious food made me salivate.
saliva[ U ] the liquid produced in your mouth to keep the mouth wet and to help to prepare food for digestion: nước bọt

children.name: spit
children.definition: to force sth out of your mouth : khạc nhổ
examples: Billy stood up slowly, rubbed his jaw, and spat blood.
spit sth out/ spit out sth
Diana tasted her martini and quickly spat it out.
He spat the meatoutin disgust.
They bought watermelons and ate them as they walked, spittingoutthe seeds.

children.name: sputum
children.definition: liquid from the passages in your body which go to the lungs, phlegm : đờm
